text.0: agni is wakened by the peoples fuel to meet the dawn who cometh like a milchcow.
text.1: like young trees shooting up on high their branches his flames are rising to the vault of heaven.
text.2: for worship of the gods the priest was wakened at morning gracious agni hath arisen.
text.3: kindled his radiant might is made apparent and the great deity set free from darkness.
text.4: when he hath stirred the line of his attendants with the pure milk pure agni is anointed.
text.5: the strengthbestowing gift is then made ready which spread in front with tongues erect he drinketh.
text.6: the spirits of the pious turn together to agni as the eyes of all to sūrya.
text.7: he when both dawns of different hues have borne him springs up at daybreak as a strong white charger.
text.8: the noble one was born at days beginning laid red in colour mid the welllaid fuel.
text.9: yielding in every house his seven rich treasures agni is seated priest most skilled in worship.
text.10: agni hath sat him down a priest most skilful on a sweetsmelling place his mothers bosom.
text.11: young faithful sage preeminent oer many kindled among the folk whom he sustaineth.
text.12: this singer excellent at sacrifices agni the priest they glorify with homage.
text.13: him who spread out both worlds by law eternal they balm with oil strong steed who never faileth.
text.14: he worshipful housefriend in his home is worshipped our own auspicious guest lauded by sages.
text.15: that strength the bull with thousand horns possesses in might o agni thou excellest others.
text.16: thou quickly passest by all others agni for him to whom thou hast appeared most lovely.
text.17: wondrously fair adorable effulgent the guest of men the darling of the people.
text.18: to thee most youthful god to thee o agni from near and far the people bring their tribute.
text.19: mark well the prayer of him who best extols thee great high auspicious agni is thy shelter.
text.20: ascend today thy splendid car o agni in splendour with the holy ones around it.
text.21: knowing the paths by midairs spacious region bring hither gods to feast on our oblation.
text.22: to him adorable sage strong and mighty we have sung forth our song of praise and homage.
text.23: gavisthira hath raised with prayer to agni this laud farreaching like gold light to heaven.
